com.giift.sdk.util

Class Culture

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.giift.sdk.util.Culture

  • public abstract class Culture
extends java.lang.Object
    Set of functions handling the localized content, such as the display of numbers and dates.
    Author:
    Nicolas Lagier

      • FormatNumber

        @NonNull
public static java.lang.CharSequence FormatNumber(double v,
                                                           java.lang.String unit)
        Format a number following the local of the phone.

      • FormatNumberWithUnit

        public static java.lang.CharSequence FormatNumberWithUnit(double v,
                                                          java.lang.String unit)
        If unit is the iso code of an official currency, then we use the standard api to display it properly. Otherwise, we just format the number nicely and display the unit afterward.
        Parameters:
        v - amount to be formatted.
        unit - can be an official currency or an unofficial one, such as miles, points...
        Returns:
        formatted string representing the amount and its currency in the phone locale.

      • IsCurrency

        public static boolean IsCurrency(java.lang.String unit)

      • GetLocalizedSymbol

        @NonNull
public static java.lang.String GetLocalizedSymbol(java.lang.String unit)
        Converts a unit into the localized representation. Currencies will be converted but other units shall remain the same.
        Parameters:
        unit - currency in iso code (e.g usd, eur, ...) or other unit (e.g points, miles...)
        Returns:
        localized version of unit

      • GetCountryName

        public static java.lang.String GetCountryName(java.lang.String countryCode)
        Transform a country ISO code into a name in the language of the device. Eg.: fr gives France if the device is in french. There are two special cases. eur will output Europe. And int will output International.
        Parameters:
        countryCode - iso code of the country. (e.g: France -> fr, Singapore -> sg, ...)
        Returns:
        country name in the language of the device

      • FormatDistance

        public static java.lang.String FormatDistance(double d,
                                              java.util.Locale locale)
        Parameters:
        d - distance in meters
        Returns:
        distance prettily formatted in a format compatible with the local
